channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Inside the 7km-long Gaza tunnel where Hamas kept Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin’s body for over 11 years
Why is Trump boycotting Africa's first G20 summit in Johannesburg?
‘23,000 lives could have been saved’: What UK Covid inquiry report reveals
Who are Netra Mantena & Vamsi Gadiraju? Inside the luxury wedding in Udaipur that Donald Trump Jr is attending
Tourist boycotts and seafood ban… The heavy price Japan is paying over Takaichi’s Taiwan remarks
Fatima Bosch, who walked out on organisers, is Miss Universe 2025. How the pageant was riddled with scandals
UN endorsing Trump’s Gaza plan is a good start, but peace requires more than ceasefire
item.description: Approval by the UN Security Council means Trump’s Gaza plan is now effective, making him the new czar in West Asia; however, only an enduring peace will decide his prospects of winning the Nobel Peace Prize

item.title: Putin’s upcoming India visit: Delhi and Moscow recalibrate ties amid global turbulence
item.description: This will be Russian President Vladimir Putin’s first visit to India since the Ukraine invasion in February 2022, underscoring its importance

item.title: Amit Shah’s red book: How it engineered the Maoists’ fall and could be a blueprint for ending future insurgencies
item.description: The Modi government’s unprecedented successes against Left-Wing Extremism have shown that insurgencies cannot be fought through development rhetoric alone. They require firm state authority, followed by inclusive development that empowers marginalised communities.

item.title: Arms sale to Taiwan deepens US-China friction as military drills intensify
item.description: While China has warned of serious consequences and may impose sanctions, the US frames the sale as a necessary sustainment measure for existing aircraft rather than an escalation

item.title: Lessons from America’s handling of the exiled Shah: Why India should stand firm on Sheikh Hasina
item.description: To appease Yunus and his Islamist backers would be no more effective than Carter’s appeasement was toward Khomeini with regard to the future trajectory of relations.

item.title: Exile, extradition and erosion of democracy in Bangladesh: The politics behind Sheikh Hasina’s death sentence
item.description: The recycling of the issues about Sheikh Hasina is engineered to conceal Muhammad Yunus’ incompetence and failure
